headline: Chef John's Creamy Mushroom Soup
description: This mushroom soup is creamy and rich. A long, slow caramelization of the mushrooms requires patience, but unlocks their magical flavor, which is the secret to this soup.

video.description: Discover the simple trick to delicious homemade creamy mushroom soup.
video.name: Chef John's Creamy Mushroom Soup

name: Chef John's Creamy Mushroom Soup
recipeIngredient: 6 sprigs fresh thyme, tied in a bundle with kitchen twine
4 cups chicken broth, or more to taste
1 cup water, or more to taste
1 salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
1 teaspoon fresh thyme leaves for garnish, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a large soup pot over medium-high heat. Saut√© mushrooms and 1 pinch salt in the melted butter until mushrooms release their juices, 5 to 10 minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low and continue to cook, stirring often, until juices evaporate and mushrooms are caramelized, 15 to 25 minutes. Set aside a few attractive mushroom slices for garnish later, if desired.
Add onion to the mushrooms; cook until onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Stir flour into the mushroom mixture and cook, stirring often, to remove the raw flour taste, about 2 minutes.
Add thyme bundle and garlic cloves, then pour in 4 cups chicken broth and 1 cup water. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 1 hour. Remove and discard thyme bundle.
Pur√©e soup with a blender in batches until smooth and thick.
Stir in cream. If too thick, add a little chicken broth or water. Season with salt and black pepper.
Ladle into bowls, and garnish with reserved mushroom slices and thyme leaves.

review.reviewBody: In addition, I used powdered dehydrated medicinal mushroom blend(Amazon) and used mushroom broth(found at Sprouts). I did not pulverize.

I made this today and it was the most delicious soup I've had in a long time. I added 1/2 cup of cream sherry and after the broth and mushrooms came to a boil, I used a hand mixer to chop 1/2 the mushrooms just before it was a puree. This is my new favorite.

Chef John did it again!.. I did not have heavy cream so I used what was in my fridge, half-n-half. I added Umami. AWESOME. Just wonderful. I used 50-50 pre sliced/prepped portabella and white. Just wonderful

I substituted creme fraiche that I had on hand (left over from another of Chef John's excellent soup recipes) for the whipping cream. Other than that I followed the recipe fairly closely. It was excellent, according to my most ardent critic (wife).
This recipe is delicious! I followed it exactly except that I used beef broth instead of chicken broth because I like it with mushrooms. A definite keeper! Thanks!
I missed the heavy cream, and used dried thyme. Cremini mushrooms. Didn't have blender either, lol. My husband and I loved it !! Will make it again the way it was written. TY.
So good i would saut√© extra mushrooms and add them to the soup after, so it has mushroom pieces inside. I also used half and half 10% cr√®me instead. Worked great

Incredibly delicious. Oh, my goodness. It's decadent. If I actually knew anything about cooking (I'm a novice, but learning fast!), I'd swear this is a French recipe. I've begun to follow Chef John very often here-- and for good reason.
I actually enjoyed this without the puree step; I guess I like to chew my soup!
Loved this soup. I will never eat or use canned again. Only change I made was using 1/2 cup of half/half.
Delicious! I diced the mushrooms and didn't blend them at the end because I like a bit of texture. I'm making it again tonight and will follow the recipe and blend it.
The soup tasted really good but there's just too much prep work. I'm sure can be more simplified.

I haven't blended the mushroom soup yet, but I wanted to say that this soup is delicious. I could eat it exactly as is without finishing. I used white beach, oyster and white mushrooms and substituted half of the chicken broth with water and left out the additional one cup of water. I also minced the garlic and added it with the mushrooms instead of removing it. Tomorrow, when we are ready to serve it for dinner, I'll reheat the soup and continue with the recipe. I think, to keep it a little less fatty, I'll use 3/4c cream and 3/4c milk. Since milk is much thinner, probably less is needed. I love this recipe and I love Allrecipes.com! Thank you Chef John! It's the next day and I finished the recipe. It turned out great. I reheated it and then used a Vitamix blender to get it completely smooth and then added 3/4c of heavy cream. It's perfectly creamy and delicious. I decided against the extra milk because that would have watered it down more than necessary. Can't wait to make this again.
Used half and half instead of cream and everyone loved it. Have made it several times now. Great recipe!
I‚Äôve made it twice. Love it! I cook it a bit longer and add more garlic‚Ä¶ but YUM!!

This was perfection! We used vegetable broth to make it vegetarian, but otherwise made as written. The hardest part was slicing 2lbs of mushrooms üòÑ Definitely spring for the fresh thyme, it adds great flavor.

This was an anomaly‚Ä¶never has a Chef John recipe failed me! I wasted some beautiful mushrooms , and 90 minutes, on this. So liquidy-even when adding another 2 tablespoons of flour. And way too much unnecessary work-I‚Äôve used much simpler mushroom soup recipes in the past that still have lots of flavor. The immersion blender didn‚Äôt produce a smooth soup; a food processor would have been better. The 4 cups of chicken stock were very, very salty-my fault, as I should have been careful to use low sodium broth.
Wow ! Creamy ! and Shroomy ! I added Parmesan cheese and blended till silky smooth then added strips of minute steak I cooked in lemon butter
Just made this as per the recipe. But it was thin. Perhaps putting a lid on the pot while it simmered was the problem. It was delicious but thin. I will not add the water next time.
Took some time to make. I used button and cremini mushrooms. Delicious soup.
added 8 oz brie
This was easy to make, especially for beginners. Instead of using thyme I used all purpose season which already has salt. This came out really good.

Just got around to trying this great recipe. I've made a few of Chef John's creations, on a repeat basis, and I'm adding this one to the repertoire üòä Several people in my life have dietary and stomach issues, so I'm on the lookout for things that are easy on the stomach, but flavorful and delicious. This recipe fits the bill! I used Baby Bellas, so the bisque came out a little darker in color, but it was just the right consistency, creamy, and decadent, just like Chef John promised. You need to devote at least 1 1/2-2 hours for the entire creation of the soup, in order to let the mushrooms saute and then caramelize (which I did for 20 min.), and then to blend the soup and bring everything together, with the cream, at the end. It is well worth the effort!

I loved it. I never knew what depth of flavor mushrooms had. I have prepared it at least a dozen times. I use coconut milk instead of dairy cream. Everything else is as recommended. My family goes crazy over this soup. I add an additional third of mushrooms etc. I get the Costco 24oz x 2. My only regret is that it doesn‚Äôt make more. Thank you Chef John.

I didn't even like mushrooms until about 6 months ago, and now I love them. Weird. Anyway, I wanted to eat mushrooms, mushrooms, and more mushrooms, so I decided to make mushroom soup. Didn't have a recipe, and Chef John only let me down once before (clotted cream), so I followed his recipe. Tweaks: Used homemade chicken bone broth instead of chicken broth; used Harlan's full-fat raw goat milk instead of cream, and added 3/4 to 1 Cup of sour cream (at the end). It was scrummy, to say the least. My hubby had to leave for a business trip the next day, and he loved it so much he said he wanted to put it in a "camel-back" and drink it through a straw as he traveled. Chef John, you help a 43-year marriage stay good--thank you!
This was ok, but not my favorite. Thanks for sharing.

Worked for me. Didn't have chicken broth, substituted with chicken stock cubes and water. May have over done the chicken stock slightly. Taking the time to do it was worth it, though I think the time taken for simmering the soup before blending the mushrooms can be reduced to 1/2 hr, of course depending on heat. Might also be something to do with the fact that I chopped the mushrooms up instead of just slicing them up. Chopping them up made sense to me as blending later on resulted in the same result imo. The flavour absorbs into the soup more readily (as attested by the browning of the broth).
We love this recipe.

This is my second time making this recipe. The first time was amazing, but I always have to put my own spin on recipes and I like to make them vegan. The following are the changes I made: Sauteed in vegan butter one red onion, 6 cloves of garlic, fresh thyme and parsley along with the mushrooms and added pepper. After adding vegetable stock and water i added two diced yellow potatoes and two diced carrots and simered for an hour. After blending in Vitamix, I added 1 cup of almond milk. Topped with more fresh ground pepper. Superb! Chef John, your version is great and my vegan version is amazing! 5 Stars

This is absolutely amazing. Done right with the time noted it truly is spectacular. The taste is wonderful and I didn‚Äôt use any water just chicken broth and herbs from the garden so everything fresh. WoW
Made it. Will do many, many more times! Loved it. Yes, takes time, but then you can do (as I did) spend the same amount of time eating it! Followed the recipe exactly.
Had high hopes. Lacking in flavor. I honestly think camlbells has more flavor. I even added a little wine and sherry to deglaze the pan
added 1tab bacon crumbles.

Great mushroom flavor. Everything worked out fine except the slow roasting of Mushrooms. It took way longer than 15 min for the mushroom liquid to evaporate but the roasted mushroom flavor can't be beat. I did put some fresh parsley on the soup along with thyme leaves while serving. The fresh parsley took it to another level. Thank you for a great and yet so easy recipe. Sonia
Awesome!

Fabulous result! Deliscious. I chose to not puree the entire pot, leaving some 'shrooms to chew. I used an emmersion blender which makes this even easier. Chef John was right... be patient. It takes a while to cook out all the water. Please excuse the parsley garnish... it's got no place in this soup! It was just handy! üòÜ
I bought sliced cremini mushrooms as they are my favorite. I also used 1/2 a cup of water and 1/2 a cup of sherry (instead of a cup of water). So delicious!

Hey Chef, amazing recipe I don‚Äôt mean to be a downer, but mushrooms if they did ‚Äúget their energy from the moon‚Äù would mean they are photosynthesizing reflected sunlight. The only problem with this is, although plant like mushrooms are not plants and do not make their own nutrients from the sun. What they do is release enzymes that break down other organic matter and feed off of this.

I loved the rich mushroom flavor. Best mushroom soup I have ever made. The payoff for that long, slow cook is huge. I sauteed some pumpkin seeds along with my choice mushrooms for a garnish. A beautiful and delicious bowl. I will make this again and again! Thanks!

It was very good at first, but didn't do well after being refrigerated overnight. I was hoping for a fairly thick soup, but mine ended up really thin which I'm sure was something I did, but I'm not messing with it again. Thanks for the recipe to try, though.

The soup is fantastic. It is our favorite mushroom soup. The one thing I would comment/change is that the time to cook the moisture out of the mushrooms is DRASTICALLY under reported. It takes a while to cook out the moisture at low heat and that is a very integral part of the process otherwise the soup doesn't taste as good.
Absolutely amazing. If you make this, I recommend adding croutons or bread crumbs, but 10/10 recommended.
This is a fantastic mushroom soup recipe! I mixed the mushrooms, used 1/2 white mushrooms and 1/2 baby portabella mushrooms. Very good!

Outstanding soup! I used a blend of mostly baby bellas, with shitakes and a few white buttons. Like other reviewers, I doubled the garlic. Instead of 1c of water, I used 1/2 cup of water and a 1/2 cup of sauvignon blanc wine. My immersion blender made quick work at the end but I intentionally left a few slices intact.
AWSOME! My husband couldn‚Äôt stop eating it. I wish I had leftovers to freeze but now will need to make more! Thank you!

I messed up a few things while making this and it turned out amazing regardless! 
1. I added extra butter because I thought there wasn't enough liquid and the mushrooms were gonna burn. Bad idea, there was WAY too much after a few mins. So when the mushrooms were soft, I strained some liquid out and made a roux with the flour instead.
2. I didn't realize I didn't have onions until after the mushrooms were already cooking. So I finished the soup minus the onions and the pureeing, picked up some onions the next day and saut√©ed them separately and then pureed the soup all together with everything cold.

I kept maybe 2 cups of mushrooms whole and added them in after the rest was pureed and it was wonderful. Will definitely be making this over and over again!
Was very good and easy to make
Whoa, this is so good! Easy, delicious. Thank you, Chef John! You hit it out of the park once again.
Used mostly standard mushrooms with a small portion of dehydrated porcino. Had to soak those a half hour. Well worth the wait.
My family loved it. It was very easy to make. We had left over turkey broth from Thanksgiving, so I used that instead of chicken broth.

This was a great recipe. Definitely not your everyday mushroom soup, but a light, tasty. and gourmet version of pure mushroom. I did not change a thing and it came out perfect. I felt like I was in a very special restaurant having a very special first course. The flavors blended together beautifully. The only thing that I would have done would be to put some pieces of mushroom into the soup because this was the main meal.
This was time consuming but delicious! Even my son loved it. Definitely need to double the recipe. Wasn‚Äôt enough for my family of 4.

Absolutely the best soup I've ever had! Took about 1 1/2 hours to make it but really time well spent. I used an Instant pot so I didn't have to be at the pot the whole time. I used custom and simmered at 200 degrees F.

I made this soup for dinner tonight. 
AMAZING!!!!!!
My husband loved it as well.
i will definitely be making it again.

The prep time is quite a bit long, but worth it. The fragrance of the mushrooms is wonderful! I used 5 different varieties I found and was so fun trying them all. I also added a splash of sherry and did part onion part shallots!
Loved int. Added grated Pecorino cheese. Did take about 1/2 an hour to get the mushrooms to the golden brown colour but was worth it.

Hands down this mushroom soup recipe is the best I‚Äôve ever made !
I was pressed for time so I made it in my pressure cooker. I used three types of mushrooms that my sister in law brought to me. She didn‚Äôt want them to spoil when she visited. 
I highly recommend this recipe!
So good. Used fresh golden oyster mushrooms. Delicious!

Love this recipe! It tastes sooo good and my family loved it. Swapped heavy whipping cream out for cooking cream and it worked equally well. Used portobello mushrooms and added some truffle oil at the end for extra flavour. Total preparation time and cooking time was within an hour. Would definitely make it again! No more canned mushroom soup!
Made it today and once before. Very delicious. Easy to make. Added a few gratings of fresh nutmeg and a splash of pinot grigio. Dale Meech
It was delicious,
Outstanding!
We love this soup, next time I plan to double the recipe because it was that good! The only change I made was to add a bit more stock. High fives Chef John, this recipe is definitely a keeper!
I made the first batch according to the recipe. A bit thin. The second time I increased the flour to 3 Tablespoons, added white wine rather than water and reduced the whipping cream to 1/2c.

Looked delicious but lacked depth and flavor. I followed the directions and used a high quality broth and fresh mushrooms but it was a huge disappointment. I don't know what it was missing. It took 45 minutes to release all the liquid from the mushrooms. Total time to prep and cook was around 3 hours.
I have made this recipe two time now. Both times it has turned out wonderful. Very smooth, full of flavor. Will continue to make.

Easy enough. Made half batch with Costco Heavy Whipping Cream, white mushrooms from Salinas (near Monterey), and their unsalted butter. Transferred it to a smaller pot in order to use my immersion blender. Substituted 1/4 tsp dry thyme for the fresh. Turned out great.
It was easy to make and tasted sooo good!
This is simply spectacular! The only thing I changed was to halve the recipe. Thank you for the great recipe!
Odd texture...

This soup comes together so easily! Luckily, my boyfriend hates mushroom anything, so I got the entire pot to myself. I don't have any qualms about this recipe & I wouldn't make a single change to it! Simple ingredients with amazing results!

This is nothing short of amazing. Everyone was practically licking their bowls clean! I rarely tweak Chef John‚Äôs recipes but I did add a little bit of sherry to this one with the broth. Also, I highly recommend watching his video. The mushrooms take close to 30 minutes to cook down and he mentions it takes a long time in the video. It‚Äôs worth the effort. We paired it with French dip sandwiches on soft but crusty hoagies. It was a great combination! Thanks Chef John!!!
ok, not great and I love mushrooms

LOVE this recipe!!! First time making mushroom soup, I have to say, I am addicted to it ..... I made it for my poor sick hubby and he kept coming into the kitchen and tasting it. I substituted half and half with butter instead of heavy whipping cream to try and cut back on some of the fat. It is soooo darn good.
Sooooo delicious I made it twice in one week!
Tastes almost exactly like the one we had in Ireland. If only we had Irish Soda Bread and a pint of Guiness!

The key is caramelizing the mushrooms and onion !
Spot on dude !!!
Simply delicious.. Easy to make also

I used pre-sliced mushrooms to speed up the prep before cooking. Also I didn't have fresh thyme so I used dried--about 1 tablespoon. As other reviewers have said, it takes much longer than 15 minutes to evaporate all the liquid from the mushrooms (even on high heat). I'd say it took closer to 30 minutes, if not longer.

I thought this soup was just okay; I was hoping for more flavor. It smelled fantastic when I was sauteeing the mushrooms and onions but I think adding 4 cups of chicken stock (plus 1 cup water) and simmering for a whole hour detracted from the taste. If I made this recipe again I'd definitely omit the cup of water. The mushroom mixture doesn't need that much liquid and I feel like it just makes things less flavorful.

This is the second time I‚Äôve made this soup. The first time was about 4 years ago, and it is as delicious as I remember it to be. While it does take some time to prepare, it has such a lovely flavor. This one is definitely going in my cook book!

I have never made mushroom soup before. This is a definite keeper! It eats like a stand alone meal. I added some cilantro as a garnishment that was a nice addition. Other than that, I followed the recipe exactly. I will agree with some other comments that this is more of a two hour prep / cooking time. Well worth the time. Thank you, Chef John.

Omgoodness, this was delicious! I love mushrooms, so, naturally, I love mushroom soup, the perfect comfort food. Thank you, Chef John, for this fantastic recipe! I will be making it often. The only thing I did differently was, I used my immersion blender right in the pot. It was actually a lot of fun to use, and one less thing to clean. I will be making this often!

For the person who complained about the onions, I don't like onions either, but by the time it's cooked through and blended up in this soup, you don't even taste it. Give it a shot! It's an excellent recipe!

I really love the taste of this soup, and I added about a 1/4 C. white wine, as suggested by other reviews. However, this took way to long to complete. It took an hour to cook the mushrooms down and then another hour as per the directions. I made this on a Sunday evening and it's now 9:00 pm. I'm not sure I'd make this again, but I might because it's really tasty!
I will tweek it next time with some wine, but it was great without it!!

Followed the recipe almost to a T. At the end I put in some truffle parm that I had from a previous recipe I made. 

This came out amazing. Definitely a keeper!
This recipe is fantastic. As others have noted, don't rush the caramelizing of the mushrooms. It takes a little time, but the results are amazing AND the soup reheats very nicely.
Sooooooo good! It takes so time but it's totally worth it. It reminds me of cream of mushroom soup you'd get at a fancy restaurant. Full of flavor. I will never try another cream of mushroom recipe.
No real changes, but I had no thyme, no cream. Used half&half in place of the cream, but didn't sub any herb for thyme. Came out delicious.
It came out pretty good. I will make it again
Not good. No flavor! Followed the recipe but very disappointed. My husband and I thought it had no flavor!!!
Wonderful! Rich and flavorful. Highly recommend.
Very easy to make and taste so delicious..
Exactly as explained. Very delicious Tq very much.

This is the only mushroom soup I ever make. I add sherry while simmering, and another splash at the end. I use fresh thyme but don‚Äôt bother with bundling it. I just pick the leaves off and toss it in. I also add about 2T of Gorgonzola cheese at the end. The first time I tried to add gorgonzola I added WAY too much and it was very overpowering. 2-3T is just about right. Makes you wonder what it is if you don‚Äôt know but can‚Äôt quite put your finger on it..an immersion blender makes it a piece of cake. The part that takes the longest is chopping the mushrooms and onion. Mushroom soup is my very favorite. I make this about once a month. So thankful for this fantastic recipe! I‚Äôm making it right now and it occurred to me I never reviewed it.

This was super easy! The result was delish! My 93 year old MIL can only eat purred food and this is perfect for her. Dinner for her tonight‚Äô. I didn‚Äôt have any cream so I had to substitute milk...still creamy and delish! Thank you Chef John!!

I have made this several times and after following the recipe the first time, I now add herbs , curry and turmeric. For those of you who don't try this because slicing the mushrooms is so time consuming, use an egg slicer! It zips through the mushrooms much faster and I always make at least 4 pounds of baby bella and plain old buttons. If they are a bit too big just cut in half. I have served this yummy soup to many guests and everyone raves.
Love this!
smells so fabulous as it's simmering. It did not dissapoint!
I love this recipe just the way it is but I also keep back a few finely chopped pieces of mushroom to add after blending because I like the mushroom pieces!
